excerpt: A delicious vegan version of a classic veggie burger.
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
2. In a large bowl, mash together the black beans and brown rice with a fork.
3. Add the nutritional yeast, bread crumbs, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, sea salt, and black pepper to the bowl and mix well.
4. In a medium skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Add the onion to the bowl with the black bean mixture and mix well.
6. Divide the mixture into 4 equal parts and shape each part into a patty.
7. Coat each patty with flour and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Bake the patties for 20 minutes, flipping them over halfway through.
9. Serve the patties on whole wheat buns with your favorite toppings.
